edu.caltech.sbw
Class ServiceInvocationHandler

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.ServiceInvocationHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
InvocationHandler
public class ServiceInvocationHandler
extends Object
implements InvocationHandler

Implementation notes: This gets called with a java Method object that represents the method on the interface. This method has to be connected to the corresponding method on the (remote) module. Given knowledge of the corresponding method on the module, invoking the method locally (i.e., what lead to us being called here) means marshalling the given args, sending a message to the module, unmarshalling the result, and returning it.

The correspondence between Method object and the remote module's method (which is to say, the remote method's id) is achieved using a hash table that hashes on the Method objects' signatures. The hash table is initialized by the class constructor.

Version:
